resources.string: Do you want to delete the receipt with registration id: %1$s

Please read these instructions carefully: 

1. Click on the '+' button to add an e-Receipt 

2. In case of an offline registration where you received a paper receipt, you will receive your registration id for the e-receipt via email. 

3. Scan the QR to get your receipt immediately, else you can also enter your registration ID (present in the system generated e-mail) to generate your e-receipt. 

4. You can save a maximum of 8 receipts at a time. If you have more, please use the e-receipt sent on your registered email address.

This CREDENZ '17 official app is here!.

This year, download our app to get all your receipts in one place. Open, scan and save. It's that easy. Download the app now!

Think about what happens when you visit a website that is poorly designed as opposed to one that is clean, easy-to-use and modern? The look and feel of a website is critical to keep visitors engaged online. If you think you can do this, it\'s time for you to design such a site. A striking blend of technology, skill and CREATIVITY can help you win this competition. Develop a website captivating enough to grab the attention of your peers and an experienced panel of judges.\n\n

1. All teams shall have to get their own laptops on the day of the competition. It is advisable to get a high speed data card (even though net connection will be provided), for your convenience. 

2. A team of maximum 3 is permissible for the event. 

3. The fee for the events is Rs 150/- for non-IEEE members and Rs 120/- for IEEE members per team. 

4. All the participants should bring receipt and valid I-cards while coming for the contest. A single team member without an I-card will result in the disqualification of the entire team. 

5. Use of any front end framework is permitted. 

6. You are allowed to use any language but readymade template must not be used. 

7. Wordpress is not allowed.

1st Round 
1. A problem statement shall be given to the participants online. 
2. The problem statement shall be released approximately 15 Days prior to the main event. 
3. The team should mail the files in zip archive. (All files with understandable documentation.) 

2nd Round 
1. The second round shall be conducted at PICT. 
2. Approximately 10 teams shall be shortlisted. 
3. The teams shall be given certain add-ons over the pages designed earlier. 
4. Five add-ons shall be given, specific to the pages designed by the participants.

1. Creativity and originality of the design. 

2. Distinct features incorporated in the design. 

3. Navigation through the site, how well the pages are interconnected. 

4. Persuasiveness of the design, the efficiency of the site to give primary information on the required theme. 

5. Based on the your Design, UI/UX and Development. 

6. Additional points will be awarded for backend development.

Design a Website for an Art Gallery Portal with the following features: 

1. The website must exhibit its facilities to artists and visitors in an interactive and responsive manner. 

2. The website must provide information about various art galleries around the world. 

3. The site must present profiles of famous artists along with their major works and masterpieces. 

4. Judging criteria includes UI/UX of the website, creativity and features that bring out uniqueness. 

5. The Structure of the site is up to the participant it may contain a single page or multiple pages. The participant might also design a section for upcoming art exhibition and Art Festivals. Additional Features to enhance your website are welcomed. The presentation must be professional with contrast to artistic elements. Images, Videos, GIFs and any other supporting media relevant to the subject can be used by the participant. 

Email your website in a zip file at webweaver.credenz17@gmail.com. 

Last date of Submission is 9th September 2017.

Football- The most breath-taking game becomes even more so when it\'s the robots that play the game! Bring your footballer-bot to the game and become a part of the most attractive of the events of Credenz \'17. As an event that surely keeps everyone\'s eyes transfixed on the field, RoboLIGA does not fail to entertain and teach at the same time. Explore the Robotics-aspect of Credenz and experience the extravagant thrill as you make your bot wade past the opponent and …that\'s right – SCORE!\n\n

1. A maximum of 3 candidates pursuing undergraduate program in their institution are allowed per team. 

2. Registration fee is Rs.200/- per team for Non-IEEE members and Rs.160/- per team for IEEE members. 

3. Teams can register at the desk put up in various colleges in and around Pune. Teams can also register at the registration desk on the day of the event, at least an hour prior to the event. 

4. ROBOT LIMITATIONS 
Maximum robot dimensions: 30cm x 30 cm x 30 cm. 
Maximum weight 3.5 kg. 

5. Power specifications: 
- Max Voltage: 12V (Normal Operation). 
- 18 V (Momentary surge on load only) allowed three times in a match. 
- The robot cannot split into two independent parts. 
- Robot should be manually controlled. 
- No weapons (blades, spikes) of any kind are to be attached onto the robot. 
- The participants are allowed to use any number of actuators. 
- Max Current 5A. 

6. There should be no intentional damage done to the other robot by means of attacking wires, wheels, motors etc. 

7. Any damage to the field or to the opposing robot would result in immediate disqualification of the team. 

8. All the participants should bring receipt and valid I-cards while coming for the contest. No one without I-card will be allowed for the contest and the team will be disqualified. 

9. If any changes are done in the competition pattern they will be uploaded on the website. For any further information keep checking the website.

1. The duration of each match will be 8 minutes (i.e. two halves, each of 4 minutes duration). A 30- seconds break will be given after half time during which the teams will be allowed to attend to their robots. 

2. Each match will be a one-on-one match between two similar teams selected randomly. For scoring system, refer to Judging Tab. 

3. The team with the highest number of points is the winner of the match. In case of a tie, a penalty shootout will be held, details of which will be announced at the time of the event. 

4. The field will be subjected to changes after the elimination rounds. The field design for final rounds will be revealed on the website before the final rounds. 

5. The teams will be short-listed for final rounds on the basis of their score in the elimination round. In final rounds, matches will be one-on-one with a different scoring system as in the Judging tab. 

6. A yellow card will be flashed on each hand touch after the first one. A maximum of three such cards will add up to a red card i.e. Disqualification. 

7. Losing teams may re-register to participate again in the elimination round. Registration fees would be Rs.150/- for this case. (Organizers reserve the rights to close the re-registrations at any point of time). 

8. Organizers have the authority to disqualify any team for misconduct or disorderly behaviour. This team would not be allowed to re-register. 

9. Organizers reserve the rights to make changes to the field design at any time without prior notification. Participants are requested to refer to the website regularly for any such changes. 

10. Organizers' decisions will be final and binding to all.

A. Elimination round: 
I. Goal from inner circle: +20 points. 
II. Goal from between inner circle and half line: +40 points 
III. Goal from beyond half line: +60 points 
IV. Negative points for Yellow Cards and fouls. 
V. Disqualification on Red Card. 
Note: This may change at the time of the event 

B. Final round: To be declared on the website after elimination round.

A C/C++ coding competition held in high regard for the conceptual challenges it brings to a coder\'s mind, \'C\'-LASH beckons all the programmers out there, amateur and experienced alike, to participate and enhance their coding skills! Utterly professional yet non-compromising on coding- fun, CLASH tests you for your speed, logic and checks if you have the right outlook towards a problem. So \'compile\' yourself and join this national-level coding combat in Credenz \'17!\n\n

1. There will be TWO rounds per group:· Elimination Round (MCQ's Round) · Coding Round (Final Round) 

2. Owing to the vast nature of the programming language, the event will be conducted in two categories, Junior Level and Senior Level. 

3. Teams can register at the registration desk on the day of the event, 1 hour prior to the event. Teams can also register at desks put up at various colleges in Pune. 

4. The competition will test the participant's programming skills and knowledge of C/C++. 

5. The Second Round structure will be declared on the spot.

1. A maximum of 2 candidates pursuing undergraduate program at their institution are allowed per team. 

2. Registration fee is Rs. 100/- per team for Non-IEEE members and Rs. 80/- per team for IEEE members. 

3. All the participants should bring receipt and valid I-cards while coming for the contest. A participant without an I-card will NOT be allowed for the contest and the respective team will be disqualified.

1. The competition will test participants programming skills and knowledge of C/C++. 

2. Time and cost efficiency of the code.

Ever had an idea or a thought deemed absurd by society? Here at MAD talks, we appreciate your crazy ideas. 
MAD talks gives you a platform to put forward your ingenious thoughts and let your imagination soar. It is a battle of grey cells and wit where insanity is sane. 
Participate and be a part of an astounding event – My Amazing Discovery. Give a presentation on what your idea is, why it is out-of-the-box and not easy to implement, yet why you think it is sheer brilliance! A platform to prove technology starts with MAD people and their MAD ideas!

1. Proposed concept should be innovative and original. 

2. A soft copy of your abstract (about 250-300 words) should be mailed to madtalks.credenz17@gmail.com 

3. The soft copy must be in *.pdf format. 

4. Summaries will be evaluated by judges and 10 (+3 waiting) entries will be qualified for the nextround. 

5. The finalists have to prepare a presentation of about 6-7 minutes (maximum time limit) that will be presented during Credenz'17 before a panel of judges. 

6. The presentation will be followed by a question - answer session based on the proposed idea. 

7. Teams will be evaluated based on their performance in the Presentation and Q/A round. 
NOTE: LCD projector and Laptop will be provided.

1. A team of maximum 3 candidates pursuing undergraduate/postgraduate/junior college course are allowed to participate. 

2. All the participants should bring their receipts and college I-cards. Those without I-cards will not be permitted and their team will be disqualified.

1. Originality and usability of the idea/plan (prime importance). 

2. The hypothesis of the plan is extremely essential and should be scientifically correct. 

3. Oratory and presentation skills of the participants. 

4. The judges' decision will be final and binding on all.

Hook onto Network Treasure Hunt, an online treasure hunt where participants follow clues and visit different websites to solve riddles. Solve a series of strategic clues to complete the track and win prizes. Decrypt rules, follow the trail and race to the finish to win exciting goodies! This is your chance to challenge your technical skills. So go on, login and be Sherlock for a day!\n\n

1.To start your hunt, go to www.credenz.info 

2.Register to get your NTH username. 

3.You will be directed to the starting page of the hunt. 

4.To advance, crack the question, and put the answer in the URL: 
FROM
http://www.nth.credenz.info/question.php 
TO
http://www.nth.credenz.info/answer.php

 

5. You need to use Google for many of them to solve. Of course, that is where you search for everything you don't know. 

6. Check the source of the pages, you will get some important clues for hunting further. The titles may also give you clues. 

7. Most importantly, do not forget to have fun!

1. There will be two Network Treasure Hunts, three and one week respectively before Credenz'17.

 

2. Both the Treasure Hunts are independent. There will be separate winners for both the Treasure Hunts. 

3. It consists of 30 to 50 levels each. 

4. To go to the next level, you need to crack the present level in any possible way.
The person who has cracked the highest number of levels wins. In case of a tie, the one who has reached first on that level is the winner.\n\n

Plot the pixels of your imagination on the virtual canvas! If you think you can carve your message with the fusion of colours, designs, words culminating into an elegant art, here is your chance. Integrate your creativity with technology and paint your ideas!\n\n

1. A team of maximum two candidates pursuing undergraduate courses are allowed per team. 

2. Registration fee is Rs.150 per team for Non-IEEE members and Rs. 120 per team for IEEE members. 

3. Each of the teams should have their own laptops on the day of the event. 

4. All the participants should bring receipt and valid I-cards while coming for the contest. No one without I-card will be allowed for the contest and the team will be disqualified.

ROUND 1: 

1. Each team shall design a promotional poster based on the given theme which will be declared on our website ONE month before the event. 

2. The date for sending the poster will be declared on the website. 

3. The designs should be submitted in *.psd,*.cdr, *.ai, etc format. 

4. The design submitted should not be flattened. 

5. The brushes and fonts used should be mentioned in the documentation. 

6. Any external source or images used should also be included in the documentation. 


ROUND 2: 

1. The teams shall be given a topic to design a poster, on the spot. 

2. The time allotted for this round will be 3 hours. 

3. You can use the internet for 20 minutes during the competition. Specific time will be allotted for the same. 

4. You are allowed to get your own brushes, fonts and textures. However, all this will be checked prior to you starting the competition.

1. Creativity and originality of the design. 

2. Distinct features incorporated in the design. 

3. Persuasiveness of the design, i.e. the efficiency of the design to convey the required message. 

4. Photoshop skills. 

5. Layering and masking. 

6. The decision of the judges will be final and shall be respected.

Since ages, humans have been inventing amenities to ease their hard work and lead a comfortable life. Throughout these ages, these amenities have eased our work for us. However in recent times, the roles seemed to have reversed. 
From placing our beds near a charging socket to compromising the privacy of people by mass surveillance to feed our advanced AI. This just indicates that a new form of Slavery is on the rise. 

Design a poster to depict how the present man is unknowingly giving rise to this modern slavery. 

Canvas size for poster should be 18” x 12” (landscape or portrait). 

Email your posters at pixelate.credenz17@gmail.com in raw formats (*.psd, *.cdr, *.ai). 

Last date of Submission is 10th September 2017.

This event, also known as B-Plan, is an opportunity for all young minds with a spark, who aim to become entrepreneurs in the near future, to THINK big and prove it to the world. It will certainly be a good opportunity to have discussions with students, just as ambitious as you, and the well-learned people who can provide valuable guidance. Come, step forward and present your innovative ideas to a distinguished panel of judges.\n\n

1. A maximum of three candidates per plan pursuing undergraduate/graduate/postgraduate program at their institution will be allowed per team. 

2. Proposed business plan should not be in violation of any intellectual property rights. 

3. Registration fee is 150/- per team for Non-IEEE members and 120/- per team for IEEE members. 

4. All the participants should bring receipt and valid I-cards while coming for the contest. No one without I-card will be allowed for the contest and the team will be disqualified.

1. At stage 1, the soft copy of the abstract (summary) should be submitted to bplan.credenz17@gmail.com 

2. The Soft copy should be a .pdf file. 

3. Evaluation of Executive Summaries by judges and Short-listing of 7 (+3 waiting) business plans for the next stage takes place. 

4. Each team will be given 12 minutes in the final round to present their B-PLAN in College Auditorium in front of panel of judges and audience. A warning bell will be given at 10 minutes and a final 2 minutes thereafter. 

5. The presentation would be followed by a question-answer session where they would be questioned on different hurdles, opportunities and obstacles at various points. 

6. The main stress during question-answer session would be given on feasibility and Exit Plan.

1. Innovation involved in the development of the idea and its practicality. 

2. Originality and Patentability. 

3. Technical feasibility. 

4. Implementation of the product. 

5. Cost efficiency (if relevant). 

6. Superiority of the product over existing products in market. 

7. Participants will be judged on the basis of their business acumen and on how sustainable and innovative their solution is. 

8. The decision of the judges will be final and shall be respected.
An Electronics based competition which tests the participants\' theoretical and practical knowledge (all students from FE to BE.)\n\n

1. The teams will be shortlisted for the next round based on their scores in the previous round. If a tie takes place, the time factor and accuracy will be taken into consideration. 

2. It will be consisting of two levels- 
Junior level 
Senior level 

3. I-card and receipt is compulsory. 

4. Electronic gadgets are not allowed.

Junior level: 
1st round: 
Section 1: Single choice MCQ's. 
Section 2: Crossword 

2nd round: 
The participants will be given a circuit with bugs on a breadboard or a general-purpose PCB along with input and expected output conditions. They have to find the bugs and debug it to obtain the correct expected output. 

3rd round: Circuit Designing and implementation 
The participants will be given a problem statement and they are supposed to implement the solution with the help of hardware. They will also be provided with input-output data, for which they have to build the required circuit. 

Senior level: 
1st round: 
Section 1: Single choice MCQ's. 
Section 2: Crossword 

2nd round: HARDWARE/SOFTWARE DEBUGGING 
The participants will be given a problem statement for which they are supposed to implement the solution for HARDWARE/SOFTWARE DEBUGGING. They will also be provided with input- output conditions. Participants will have to write a code for SOFTWARES. 

3rd round: Circuit Designing and implementation 
The participants will be given a problem statement for which they are supposed to implement the solution with the help of hardware/software (Proteus).They will also be provided with input-output waveforms for which they have to build the desired circuit.

It will test your basic knowledge of electronics and practical implementation.

Total Shortlisted teams for 2nd round-12 
Total Shortlisted teams for 3rd round -6

Ever wondered how those blue collars sitting in their corner office make deals worth over billions of dollars? Also, ever wondered why is there so much chaos due to the fluctuations in Sensex? Here is a virtual stock market to get a glimpse of everything that happens on Dalal Street.\n\n

1.Every Participating candidate should be pursuing Undergraduate/Graduate courses. 

2.Registration fee is Rs.50 per individual for Non-IEEE member and Rs.40 for IEEE member. 

3.All the participants should bring valid I-cards while coming for the contest. No one without I-card will be allowed for the contest and the team will be disqualified.

1. The event will be conducted within PICT campus on all 3 days. 

2. Every participant will be given virtual money to trade on our virtual stock market. 

3. The event will be conducted via our App/Website. 

4. Mock NEWS will be flashed regarding listed companies and their sectors based on which participants will buy/sell stocks to ultimately become the biggest gainer. 

5. Concepts such as IPO, short selling and high Frequency Trading will be inculcated within the event.
Top 3 participants with Highest Capital at the end of Day 3 will be declared as winners.\n\n

Given some sequence of steps, writing a code and getting the output is pretty easy! Want to try a reverse way? If given some input and output, can you find the logic and sequence? Focusing less on concepts, all you need is your logical skill to decipher this "Black Box". Reverse Coding is a logical event which tests your basic logical skills along with pattern analysis and recognition as you play with the code. So, get ready to reverse code in Credenz\'17!\n\n

1. There are two rounds: 
a. Logic Round. 
b. Decipher and Code Round. 

2. Logic round consists of Logical questions which can be solved by coding. 

3. In the Decipher and coding round, the participants have to write the code for pattern that maps input to output. 

4. The event will be conducted in two categories, Junior level(First and Second year) and Senior level(Third and Fourth year).

1. A maximum of 2 candidates pursuing undergraduate program at their institution are allowed per team. 

2. Registration fees is Rs.70/- per team for Non-IEEE members and Rs.50/- per team for IEEE members. 

3. All the participants should bring their receipt and valid I-cards while coming for the contest. A participant without an I-card will NOT be allowed for the contest and the respective team will be disqualified. 

4. Marking scheme will be declared on spot.

1. The competition will test the participants' logical and coding skills. 

2. Time and cost efficiency of the code will be tested in round 2.

Have you ever wondered how to apply toothpaste on your brush in 20 steps? Ever wondered how to light a candle in 30 steps? Contraption is all about complexifying the simplest of things you see around yourself. Its whole essence lies in a perfectly balanced mix of innovation, creativity, relevance which results in profound entertainment.\n\n

1. A team of max. four members is allowed to participate. 

2. Registration fees is Rs.200/- per team for Non-IEEE members and Rs.180/- per team for IEEE members. 

3. Machine should be of dimensions 8ft x 8ft x 8ft (maximum). 

4. Minimum 10 steps should be involved to complete the task otherwise team will be disqualified. However there is no constrain on maximum no. of steps. 

5. Minimum 4 different energy conversion should be implemented in machine. Otherwise team will be disqualified. 

6. Machine should perform the task in maximum of 4 minutes. 

7. Machine should not take support of any of four walls and ceiling. 

8. Teams have to submit abstract and flowchart in prescribed format well before the deadline for first round. 

9. Maximum of three trials/chances will be given to any team. For every other chance/trial there will be deduction of points. 

10. For every next chance reset time of 15 mins will be given to team. 

11. Only one team member is allowed to interact with the machine once the evaluation has begun. This includes resetting the machine during the run. This means that only one person will be allowed inside the arena. However, if the team goes for another run, the restriction of one person inside the arena is uplifted until the machine is ready for the other run. 

12. That person will explain about the machine and each step going on to judges. 

13. Each step in the machine should be considered as the transfer of one energy into another. A step is considered to accomplish when there is energy transformation. Example ball coming down from the wedge and hitting the domino is consider a step. In this potential energy of ball gets changed into kinetic energy while coming down and when it hits the domino, it transfers its energy to domino. 

14. Identical transfers of energy in succession should be considered one step. For eg., a set of dominos falling into each other should be considered one step. While technically each single domino falling is a step, stating one hundred steps for hundred dominos is repetitive and against the spirit of Rube Goldberg. 

15. You can use any material for making of your machine provided in any case , they does not lead damage to arena and other machines. Otherwise it will lead to disqualification of team. 

16. Hazardous materials are not allowed and any gas or any explosives are also not allowed. However you can use matchstick if required provided it does not damage the arena and any other Machine. 

17. We will not provide you any material for making of your Machine. However basic stationary materials will be provided to you. 

18. If required extension boards will be provided to you. But we would really appreciate if you bring of your own. 

19. Bring 2 copies of abstract when you perform in college. 

20. No live animal should be used. 

21. Organizers have the right to change a rule or all if they feel.

Round 1 
1. Problem statement will be released on the website 15 days prior to the event. 

2.Participants have to mail their abstract to email id contraption.credenz17@gmail.com. 


Round 2 
1. Best abstracts will be shortlisted from the first round. 

2. These teams will be allowed to come to college and demonstrate their machine and present their innovation.

Judging criteria is as follows: 

1. Design of your machine 

2. Number of steps involved in it 

3. Number of different types of energy conversions involved 

4. Aesthetic of machine 

5. Presentation 

6. Innovation 

7. Will test elementary knowledge of applied physics of team. 

8. Innovative and team management skills will also be tested.

1. Design a machine of (8*8*8) cubic ft that plays Sa-Re-Ga-Ma-Pa-Dha-Ni-Sa at different stages till the final step. 

2. During execution, your machine should display CREDENZ '17 at any intermediate state. 

3. Maximum execution time is 4 minutes. 

4. Email your abstract at contraption.credenz17@gmail.com 

5. Last date of Submission is 9th September 2017.

It is always said that knowledge is not something to be confined to oneself, but something to be shared as much as possible. One of the most popular events of Credenz, Paper Presentation gives a platform to undergraduate/ postgraduate students to present technical papers. So, here is your chance to challenge your own skills of research and put forth your ideas on technology in front of an experienced panel of judges.\n\n

1. A team of maximum three candidates pursuing undergraduate / postgraduate program are allowed. 

2. Registration fees is Rs.200/- per team for Non-IEEE members and Rs.180/- per team for IEEE members. 

3. All the participants should bring valid I-cards while coming for the contest. No one without I-card will be allowed for the contest and the team will be disqualified.

1. Only soft copy i.e. a .pdf file, of the paper and abstract should be submitted. The paper should not exceed more than 6 pages. 

2. Soft copy of the technical paper and the abstract should be mailed to paper.credenz17@gmail.com. 

3. The paper must strictly adhere to the IEEE format. 

4. Authors will get 15 minutes to deliver a presentation on their topic followed by a question - answer session. 

5. The presentation should be in power point format (.ppt or .pptx).

1. Oratory and Presentation skills will be of prime importance. 

2. Relevance of the content in context with the chosen topic. 

3. Judge's decision will be final and binding on all.

There is no measure for intelligence and wisdom. The closest we could reach was by defining an IQ. Fortunately each of us is gifted with this feature. The question is, till what extend we possess it. 
Discover the scope of this feature by Setting out on a voyage through a sea of mind-boggling questions captained by a witty quizmaster.

The Quiz is divided into following three categories held on three different days: 
1. General Quiz: It includes everything from robotics to politics. Test your GK! 
2. MELA Quiz: Movies Entertainment Literature and Arts (MELA) is all set to test your knowledge of literature, arts and entertainment. If you are an entertainment lover, this is for you! 
3. Biz Tech Quiz: If you are passionate about marketing, economics and business, then Biz Tech is the ultimate questionnaire you need to answer to test your knowledge. 

So brace yourself for captivating this intriguing questionnaire whose answers might just be lying somewhere at the back of your mind.

1. A maximum of two candidates pursuing under graduate/graduate program at their institution will be allowed per team. 

2. Registration fees is Rs.50/- per team per quiz for Non-IEEE members and Rs.40/- per team per quiz for IEEE members. 

3. Teams can register at desks put up at various colleges in and around Pune. No one without I-card will be allowed for the contest and the team will be disqualified. A team has to register itself at registration desk at time of event, one hour prior to the event. 

4. Teams may re-register for another time slot. 

5. All the participants should bring receipt and valid I-cards while coming for the event.

1. There will be two rounds - one elimination rounds and one final round. 

2. Details about structure of quiz will be provided at the time of the event. 

3. Quiz masters' decision will be final on all matters. 

4. Round 1 will be elimination round with no negative marking and round 2 will be conducted by the Quiz Master.

Round 1: 
1. For this round 25 questions will be asked. 
2. Top 6 teams will be short listed for the second round. 

Round 2: 
There will be 6 teams in the final round. The round will be conducted by the Quiz Master.

Software Development will be an Application Development Competition, android or desktop with no restriction on the choice of programming language used. You can use ANY existing programming language(s) to make your application. The application will be judged by experts in the software industry.\n\n

1. Maximum of Three people in a team. 

2. It will be consisting of two levels- 
Junior level (For First and Second Year students) 
Senior level (For Third and Fourth Year students) 

3. All the participants should bring receipt and valid I-cards while coming for the contest. A single team member without an I-card will result in the disqualification of the entire team.

1. Participants will have to showcase their software applications on the day of event(i.e. Credenz '17). 

2. Winners will be declared once all applications have been reviewed by judges.

Junior Category: 
Design and implement an application based on one of the following topics: 

1. Design and implement an application which helps users find out about the various events (eg. Stand up, dramas, flee markets, concerts, sports events)taking place in a city(eg. Pune). The categories of events can be decided by the developer. 

2. Design and implement an application for book lovers which would enable them to lend and borrow books. Users should be able to enlist the books they are willing to lend. Also, they should be able to search for books available for borrowing. Additional features are left up to the participants discretion. 

3. Design and implement an application for artists and art lovers. The application will be a platform for artists such as painters, sculptors, musicians, graphic designer etc to showcase their talents in their respective fields. The app also enables art connoisseurs to view the art, contact the artist and buy their art. Authentication and piracy related issues should be taken into consideration by the developer. 

4. Design and implement an app of your choice. 


Senior Category: 
Design and implement an application based on one of the following topics: 

1. Sentiment analysis. 

2. Women safety. 

3. Using technology to enhance Road transportation. 

4. Computational and data security. 

5. Neural Networks. 

6. Image processing. 

7. Social Media. 

8. Mobile Computing.

Criteria for Judging would consist of multiple parameters:

 

1. User Interface 

2. User friendliness 

3. Deployment Scenarios 

4. Presentability 

5. Scenario Adaptability 

6. Feature Richness 

7. And a few more. 

Scenario Adaptability: You might be asked to clarify the use of your application in certain scenarios, say What if this software needs to be used in a Library? Or on a Cruiser? Can you elaborate on how that can be accomplished? What if this needs to be deployed in Software Company's office? At a manager's desk?

The Bot Game is a game between two programmed codes. The code can be programmed in either C/C++/Java/Python. Two bots will play against each other in a match, which is carried out by a programmed Game-Judge. The details of the game will be put up on the XOdia'17 website during Credenz. 

Registration is free of cost. 

Time period for programming the bot: 15 days. 

Allowed Languages: C/C++/Java/Python

1. A single person is allowed to participate, no teams will be entertained and may lead to disqualification. 

2. Participants need to provide required information on and as and when required. 

3. Any malicious activity encountered by the bot will lead to disqualification. 

4. Participants are allowed to send modified/corrected codes before the last date of submission (Submission dates will be released on the website). Any request for modification of code will not be entertained after that.

1. Submission Procedure: The programmed bots have to be submitted on the website by the last day of submission given on the website. 

2. The rules of the game and details of the interaction of the bot will be with the game description on the Website.
The rules for scoring and deciding the winner will be mentioned on the website, with the game details.\n\n

PICT IEEE Newsletter Group 

P.I.N.G. is the official technical magazine of PISB published biannually. P.I.N.G. serves as a platform for individuals to portray their technical ingenuity. It highlights articles on cutting-edge technology from technocrats all around the globe including students, industrialists and faculty members. It also features interviews of distinguished personalities in various technical domains. P.I.N.G. aims at keeping its readers up to date on recent developments in technology and helps them extrapolate their perceptions to contemporary ideas of modernisation.

With the imminent Issue 13.1, get ready to be PING'd!
